Quote: Judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
French: [translate:On doit juger un homme d'après ses questions plutôt que d'après ses réponses.]
Context: Promotes curiosity as the root of wisdom.
Bio: Voltaire challenged dogma and taught intellectual skepticism.

Quote: Common sense is not so common.
French: [translate:Le bon sens est fort rare.]
Context: Observes the rarity of sound judgment.

Quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
French: [translate:Le doute est désagréable, mais la certitude est ridicule.]
Context: Values open-mindedness and humility over dogmatism.
Bio: Voltaire used wit to challenge rigid beliefs.

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
French: [translate:Plus je lis, plus j'acquiers, plus je suis certain que je ne sais rien.]
Context: Learning reveals the vastness of the unknown.

Quote: No opinion is worth burning your neighbor for.
French: [translate:Aucune opinion ne vaut la peine de brûler son voisin.]
Context: Warns against ideological extremism and violence.

Quote: Is there anyone so wise as to learn by the experience of others?
French: [translate:Y a-t-il quelqu'un d'assez sage pour apprendre par l'expérience d'autrui?]
Context: Reflects on the rarity of wisdom through learning from others.

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
French: [translate:Il doit être bien ignorant puisqu'il répond à toutes les questions qu'on lui pose.]
Context: Highlights arrogance in pretending to know everything.

Quote: The secret of being a bore is to tell everything.
French: [translate:Le secret d’ennuyer est de tout dire.]

Quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood.
French: [translate:La décision la plus importante que vous puissiez prendre est d'être de bonne humeur.]

Quote: To the living we owe respect, to the dead we owe only truth.
French: [translate:Aux vivants nous devons le respect, aux morts nous devons seulement la vérité.]

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of God.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de Dieu.]
Context: Points to the non-inherent nature of belief.

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
French: [translate:Ceux qui peuvent vous faire croire des absurdités peuvent vous faire commettre des atrocités.]

Quote: Anyone who has the power to make you believe absurdities has the power to make you commit injustices.
French: [translate:Quiconque a le pouvoir de vous faire croire des absurdités a le pouvoir de vous faire commettre des injustices.]
Context: Links uncritical belief to dangerous outcomes.

Quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
French: [translate:Tenir une plume, c'est être en guerre.]
Context: Writing as an act of intellectual struggle.

Quote: Life is a shipwreck, but we must not forget to sing in the lifeboats.
French: [translate:La vie est un naufrage, mais nous ne devons pas oublier de chanter dans les canots de sauvetage.]

Quote: God is a circle whose center is everywhere and circumference nowhere.
French: [translate:Dieu est un cercle dont le centre est partout et la circonférence nulle part.]

Quote: Paper money eventually returns to its intrinsic value—zero.
French: [translate:La monnaie-papier finit toujours par revenir à sa valeur intrinsèque qui est nulle.]

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]

Quote: Sensual pleasure passes and vanishes, but the friendship between us, the mutual confidence, the delight of the heart, the enchantment of the soul, these things do not perish and can never be destroyed.
French: [translate:Le plaisir sensuel passe et disparaît, mais l'amitié entre nous, la confiance mutuelle, la joie du cœur, le charme de l'âme, ces choses ne périssent pas et ne peuvent jamais être détruites.]

Quote: He who thinks himself wise, O heavens! is a great fool.
French: [translate:Celui qui se croit sage, ô cieux! est un grand fou.]

Quote: There are truths which are not for all men, nor for all times.
French: [translate:Il y a des vérités qui ne sont pas pour tous les hommes, ni pour tous les temps.]

Quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.
French: [translate:Aimez ceux qui cherchent la vérité, fuyez ceux qui la trouvent.]
Context: Values search for truth over certainty.

Quote: The biggest reward for a thing well done is to have done it.
French: [translate:La plus grande récompense d'une chose bien faite est de l'avoir faite.]

Quote: Thinking is the enemy of perfection.
French: [translate:Penser est l'ennemi de la perfection.]
Context: Perfection is elusive; thinking exposes flaws.

Quote: I do not agree with what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
French: [translate:Je ne suis pas d'accord avec ce que vous dites, mais je défendrai jusqu'à la mort votre droit de le dire.]
Context: Principle of free speech and respect for diverse opinions.

Quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
French: [translate:L'homme est libre au moment où il veut l'être.]
Context: Freedom is a matter of personal resolve.

Quote: Liberty of thought is the life of the soul.
French: [translate:La liberté de penser est la vie de l'âme.]
Context: Mental freedom as the soul's essence.

Quote: It is dangerous to be right when the government is wrong.
French: [translate:Il est dangereux d'avoir raison dans des affaires où des hommes en place ont tort.]

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
French: [translate:Ceux qui peuvent vous faire croire des absurdités peuvent vous faire commettre des atrocités.]

Quote: Think for yourself and let others enjoy the privilege of doing so too.
French: [translate:Pensez par vous-même et laissez aux autres le privilège d’en faire autant.]

Quote: Liberty and freedom are the language of nations.
French: [translate:La liberté et la franchise sont le langage des nations.]
Context: Liberty as the foundation for collective rights.

Quote: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
French: [translate:Aucun flocon de neige dans une avalanche ne se sent responsable.]

Quote: Present opportunities are not to be neglected; they rarely visit us twice.
French: [translate:Les occasions présentes ne doivent pas être négligées; elles nous visitent rarement deux fois.]
Context: Importance of seizing one's moment of freedom.

Quote: The right to free thought is the most sacred of rights.
French: [translate:Le droit de penser librement est le plus sacré des droits.]
Context: Asserts freedom of mind as essential.

Quote: Freedom is the only gift of nature, all the rest is the effect of society.
French: [translate:La liberté est la seule faveur de la nature, tout le reste est l’effet de la société.]
Context: Sees liberty as inherent to humans.

Quote: When tyranny rules, freedom dies.
French: [translate:Quand la tyrannie règne, la liberté meurt.]
Context: Warns about the threat of oppressive rule.

Quote: Liberty is not only a right, it is a duty.
French: [translate:La liberté n’est pas seulement un droit, c’est un devoir.]

Quote: He who lives only for himself is truly free; all others are slaves.
French: [translate:Celui qui ne vit que pour lui-même est vraiment libre; tous les autres sont des esclaves.]

Quote: Freedom consists not in doing what we like, but in having the right to do what we ought.
French: [translate:La liberté ne consiste pas à faire ce qu'on aime, mais à avoir le droit de faire ce qu'on doit.]

Quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
French: [translate:Tout homme est coupable de tout le bien qu'il n'a pas fait.]
Context: Responsibility as a consequence of liberty.

Quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
French: [translate:L'amour est le triomphe de l'imagination sur l'intelligence.]

Quote: One word frees us of all the weight and pain of life: that word is love.
French: [translate:Un mot nous délivre de tout le poids et de toute la douleur de la vie: ce mot est amour.]

Quote: All men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Merit as a true ground of freedom.

Quote: True freedom is the power to act honestly.
French: [translate:La vraie liberté est le pouvoir d'agir honnêtement.]
Context: Virtue and honesty promote true liberty.

Quote: As long as people believe in absurdities they will continue to commit atrocities.
French: [translate:Tant que les gens croient aux absurdités, ils continueront à commettre des atrocités.]
Context: Reason as a safeguard against oppression.

Quote: Freedom is won by those who dare.
French: [translate:La liberté est gagnée par ceux qui osent.]
Context: Courage as a route to freedom.

Quote: Liberty is the soul of all nations.
French: [translate:La liberté est l'âme de toutes les nations.]

Quote: Liberty is the only true happiness.
French: [translate:La liberté est le seul vrai bonheur.]

Quote: Freedom is precious and fragile, defend it always.
French: [translate:La liberté est précieuse et fragile; il faut toujours la défendre.]

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]
Context: Comments on religion's role in human society.
Bio: Voltaire was a critic of dogma and superstition.

Quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy.
French: [translate:La superstition est à la religion ce que l'astrologie est à l'astronomie.]
Bio: Often attacked superstition in religious practices.

Quote: The interest I have in believing a thing is not a proof that such a thing exists.
French: [translate:L'intérêt que j'ai à croire une chose n'est pas une preuve de l'existence de cette chose.]
Context: Faith is not proof of existence.

Quote: Every sensible man, every honorable man, must hold the Christian religion in horror.
French: [translate:Tout homme sensé, tout homme honnête doit avoir en horreur la religion chrétienne.]

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of God.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec une connaissance de Dieu.]
Context: Points to the non-inherent nature of faith.

Quote: Faith consists in believing when it is beyond the power of reason to believe.
French: [translate:La foi consiste à croire quand il est au-delà du pouvoir de la raison de croire.]

Quote: God is a comedian playing to an audience too afraid to laugh.
French: [translate:Dieu est un comédien jouant devant un public trop effrayé pour rire.]

Quote: If God created us in his image, we have certainly returned the compliment.
French: [translate:Si Dieu nous a créés à son image, nous le lui avons bien rendu.]
Context: Critiques human creation of God’s image.

Quote: Religion began as a mythology, was elevated into a philosophy, and degraded into a superstition.
French: [translate:La religion a commencé comme une mythologie, élevée à la philosophie et dégradée en superstition.]
Context: Stages in the history of religion.

Quote: As long as people believe in absurdities they will continue to commit atrocities.
French: [translate:Tant que les gens croient aux absurdités, ils continueront à commettre des atrocités.]

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]

Quote: Superstition sets the whole world in flames; philosophy quenches them.
French: [translate:La superstition met le monde en feu; la philosophie l’éteint.]

Quote: If God did not exist, we would have to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]

Quote: Religion is the art of inspiring fear and awe in the ignorant.
French: [translate:La religion est l'art d'inspirer la crainte et l'admiration chez les ignorants.]

Quote: Inclination is never so strong as when reason is weak.
French: [translate:L'inclination n'est jamais si forte que lorsque la raison est faible.]

Quote: God does not exist. But don't tell that to my servant, lest he murder me at night.
French: [translate:Dieu n'existe pas. Mais ne le dites pas à mon domestique, de peur qu'il ne me tue la nuit.]

Quote: Christianity is the most ridiculous, the most absurd, and the most bloody religion that has ever infected the world.
French: [translate:Le christianisme est la plus absurde, la plus sanguinaire, et la plus ridicule des religions qui ait jamais infecté le monde.]

Quote: The world embarrasses me, and I cannot dream that this watch exists and has no watchmaker.
French: [translate:Le monde m'embarrasse, et je ne peux penser que cette montre existe et n'ait pas de fabricant.]

Quote: In general, the art of government consists in taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
French: [translate:En général, l'art de gouverner consiste à prendre autant d'argent que possible d'une classe de citoyens pour le donner à une autre.]
Context: Examines links between church, state, and wealth.

Quote: Fanaticism is a monster that professes to be the child of religion.
French: [translate:Le fanatisme est un monstre qui prétend être l'enfant de la religion.]

Quote: Men will always be mad, and those who think they can cure them are the maddest of all.
French: [translate:Les hommes seront toujours fous, et ceux qui croient pouvoir les guérir sont les plus fous de tous.]

Quote: God made man in his image, and man has returned the favor.
French: [translate:Dieu a créé l'homme à son image, et l'homme le lui a bien rendu.]

Quote: There are as many religions as there are people.
French: [translate:Il y a autant de religions qu'il y a d'hommes.]

Quote: If God is just, he will forgive. If he is powerful, he will punish. But if he exists, he will not be like we expect.
French: [translate:Si Dieu est juste, il pardonnera. S'il est puissant, il punira. Mais s'il existe, il ne sera pas comme nous l'attendons.]

Quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
French: [translate:Tout homme est coupable de tout le bien qu'il n'a pas fait.]

Quote: We must cultivate our garden.
French: [translate:Il faut cultiver notre jardin.]
Context: Metaphor for personal improvement and moral action.

Quote: Virtue is not hereditary.
French: [translate:La vertu n'est pas héréditaire.]
Context: Ethical behavior does not come from birth.

Quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty person than to condemn an innocent one.
French: [translate:Il vaut mieux hasarder de sauver un coupable que de condamner un innocent.]
Context: Favors mercy and fairness over rigid law.

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]

Quote: The weak are cruel. Gentleness can only be expected from the strong.
French: [translate:Les faibles sont cruels. La douceur ne peut être attendue que des forts.]
Context: Compassion is a strength, not a weakness.

Quote: Let us read and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.
French: [translate:Il faut lire et il faut danser; ces deux amusements ne feront jamais de mal au monde.]
Context: Promotes innocent pleasures as moral goods.

Quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
French: [translate:Une bonne plaisanterie ne prouve rien.]
Context: Humor does not replace rational argument.

Quote: The pursuit of pleasure must be the goal of every rational creature.
French: [translate:La recherche du plaisir doit être le but de toute créature raisonnable.]

Quote: He who thinks himself wise, O heavens! is a great fool.
French: [translate:Celui qui se croit sage, ô cieux! est un grand fou.]

Quote: Madness is to think of too many things in succession too fast, or of one thing too exclusively.
French: [translate:La folie est de penser trop de choses à la fois, ou de n'en penser qu'une seule.]
Context: Calls for moral balance and moderation.

Quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
French: [translate:Tenir une plume, c'est être en guerre.]
Context: Words can fight for moral reform.

Quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l'ennemi du bien.]

Quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.
French: [translate:Aimez ceux qui cherchent la vérité, fuyez ceux qui la trouvent.]
Context: Encourages pursuit rather than certainty in morality.

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]

Quote: No opinion is worth burning your neighbor for.
French: [translate:Aucune opinion ne vaut la peine de brûler son voisin.]
Context: Condemns violence in the name of belief.

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Places merit and virtue above station.

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]

Quote: The right to free thought is the most sacred of rights.
French: [translate:Le droit de penser librement est le plus sacré des droits.]

Quote: Inclination is never so strong as when reason is weak.
French: [translate:L'inclination n'est jamais si forte que lorsque la raison est faible.]
Context: Warns against giving in to impulse.

Quote: Liberty is not only a right, it is a duty.
French: [translate:La liberté n’est pas seulement un droit, c’est un devoir.]
Context: Ethical connection between rights and duty.

Quote: Work is a refuge from unhappiness.
French: [translate:Le travail est un refuge contre le malheur.]
Context: Work as a source of moral and personal happiness.

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
French: [translate:Il doit être bien ignorant puisqu'il répond à toutes les questions qu'on lui pose.]

Quote: Thinking is the enemy of perfection.
French: [translate:Penser est l'ennemi de la perfection.]
Context: Ethics must be practical, not perfect.

Quote: The biggest reward for a thing well done is to have done it.
French: [translate:La plus grande récompense d'une chose bien faite est de l'avoir faite.]

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]
Context: Critique of irrational tradition in society.

Quote: All styles are good except the tiresome kind.
French: [translate:Tous les genres sont bons, sauf le genre ennuyeux.]

Quote: An optimist is a madman who insists all is well when he is in hell.
French: [translate:Un optimiste est un fou qui prétend que tout va bien quand il est en enfer.]
Context: Mocks blind optimism and societal denial.

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]

Quote: Madness is to think of too many things in succession too fast, or of one thing too exclusively.
French: [translate:La folie est de penser trop de choses à la fois, ou de n'en penser qu'une seule.]
Context: Mental health and balance in society.

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]
Context: Shows society's need for higher purpose.

Quote: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone else's eyes.
French: [translate:Le miroir est une invention inutile. La seule façon de vraiment se voir est dans le regard des autres.]

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]

Quote: Prejudices are the reason of fools.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont la raison des sots.]

Quote: It is not enough to conquer; one must also seduce.
French: [translate:Il ne suffit pas de conquérir; il faut aussi séduire.]
Context: Charm and persuasion in social success.

Quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
French: [translate:Une bonne plaisanterie ne prouve rien.]

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
French: [translate:Il doit être bien ignorant puisqu'il répond à toutes les questions qu'on lui pose.]
Context: Social critique of ignorance as wisdom.

Quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
French: [translate:Le cœur a ses raisons que la raison ne connaît pas.]

Quote: Common sense is not so common.
French: [translate:Le bon sens est fort rare.]
Context: Comments on lack of practical judgment in public.

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of geometry.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de la géométrie.]

Quote: If God created us in his image, we have certainly returned the compliment.
French: [translate:Si Dieu nous a créés à son image, nous le lui avons bien rendu.]

Quote: Truths are illusions we have forgotten are illusions.
French: [translate:Les vérités sont des illusions que nous avons oubliées comme telles.]

Quote: Let us read and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.
French: [translate:Il faut lire et il faut danser; ces deux amusements ne feront jamais de mal au monde.]

Quote: Liberty is not only a right, it is a duty.
French: [translate:La liberté n’est pas seulement un droit, c’est un devoir.]
Context: Societal rights rooted in mutual responsibility.

Quote: Work is a refuge from unhappiness.
French: [translate:Le travail est un refuge contre le malheur.]

Quote: Thinking is the enemy of perfection.
French: [translate:Penser est l'ennemi de la perfection.]

Quote: Sensual pleasure passes and vanishes, but friendship remains.
French: [translate:Le plaisir sensuel passe, l’amitié reste.]

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]

Quote: There are as many societies as there are opinions.
French: [translate:Il y a autant de sociétés qu'il y a d'opinions.]
Context: Each group governed by its own values.

Quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
French: [translate:L'amour est un canevas fourni par la nature et brodé par l'imagination.]
Context: Love as creative force and inspiration.

Quote: Tears are the silent language of grief.
French: [translate:Les larmes sont le langage silencieux du chagrin.]
Context: Expresses deep sorrow and loss through love.

Quote: The heart has its reasons which reason knows not.
French: [translate:Le cœur a ses raisons que la raison ne connaît pas.]
Context: Recognizes the irrationality and power of love.
Bio: Quoted Pascal’s notion of the heart.

Quote: Love is of all passions the strongest, for it attacks simultaneously the head, the heart, and the senses.
French: [translate:L'amour est de toutes les passions la plus forte, car elle attaque à la fois la tête, le cœur, et les sens.]

Quote: One always speaks badly when one has nothing to say.
French: [translate:On parle toujours mal quand on n'a rien à dire.]

Quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
French: [translate:L'amour est le triomphe de l'imagination sur l'intelligence.]
Context: Creativity and imagination as sources of love.

Quote: A true lover always feels in debt to the one he loves.
French: [translate:Un vrai amoureux se sent toujours redevable envers celui qu’il aime.]

Quote: Love is subject to jealousy; jealousy is subject to love.
French: [translate:L'amour est soumis à la jalousie; la jalousie est soumise à l'amour.]
Context: Examines relationship between love and jealousy.

Quote: There is only one thing more important than love in the world: friendship.
French: [translate:Il n'y a qu'une chose plus importante que l'amour dans le monde: l'amitié.]
Context: Distinguishes love and friendship in values.

Quote: To love is to suffer. To avoid suffering, one must not love.
French: [translate:Aimer, c'est souffrir. Pour éviter de souffrir, il ne faut pas aimer.]
Context: Portrays the pain and vulnerability of love.

Quote: Love is stronger than fear.
French: [translate:L'amour est plus fort que la peur.]
Context: Love gives strength to overcome fears.

Quote: The best is the enemy of love.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l'ennemi de l'amour.]
Context: Warnings against perfectionist expectations in love.

Quote: In affairs of the heart, reason is always deceived.
French: [translate:En matière de cœur, la raison est toujours trompée.]

Quote: Love is a fire that burns unseen, it is a wound that never heals.
French: [translate:L'amour est un feu qui brûle sans se voir, c'est une blessure qui ne guérit jamais.]
Context: Passionate and enduring pain of love.

Quote: Love is the only thing that can turn enemies into friends.
French: [translate:L'amour est la seule chose qui puisse transformer les ennemis en amis.]
Context: Power of love to foster forgiveness.

Quote: The more you love, the less logic you use.
French: [translate:Plus on aime, moins on utilise la logique.]

Quote: Love is blind and lovers cannot see the silly things they do.
French: [translate:L'amour est aveugle et les amoureux ne voient pas les bêtises qu'ils font.]
Context: Highlights folly and blindness of affection.

Quote: Happiness in love is a rare thing: most people find pain or disappointment.
French: [translate:Le bonheur en amour est une chose rare : la plupart des gens y trouvent douleur ou déception.]
Context: Love's joys are difficult to attain.

Quote: Love's greatest pleasure is in the anticipation.
French: [translate:Le plus grand plaisir de l'amour est dans l'attente.]

Quote: Jealousy is the tyrant of love.
French: [translate:La jalousie est le tyran de l'amour.]

Quote: The art of love is largely the art of persistence.
French: [translate:L'art d'aimer est surtout l'art de persévérer.]

Quote: Love is the poet’s favorite subject, because love is the most poetic of feelings.
French: [translate:L'amour est le sujet préféré du poète, parce que l'amour est le plus poétique des sentiments.]

Quote: True love does not measure, but gives.
French: [translate:Le véritable amour ne mesure pas, il donne.]

Quote: To love and be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.
French: [translate:Aimer et être aimé est le plus grand bonheur de l'existence.]

Quote: Love asks for nothing but love.
French: [translate:L'amour ne demande rien d'autre que l'amour.]

Quote: Passion is the wind that drives the ship of love.
French: [translate:La passion est le vent qui pousse le navire de l'amour.]

Quote: The great achievement of science is to rid the mind of dogma.
French: [translate:La grande réussite de la science est de débarrasser l'esprit du dogme.]
Context: Praises science’s power to overcome superstition.

Quote: We must define words, or they will define us.
French: [translate:Il faut définir les mots, ou ils nous définiront.]
Context: Emphasizes need for clear terms in science.

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of geometry.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de la géométrie.]

Quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy.
French: [translate:La superstition est à la religion ce que l'astrologie est à l'astronomie.]

Quote: The most useful books are those whose readers believe they could have written them.
French: [translate:Les livres les plus utiles sont ceux dont les lecteurs pensent qu'ils auraient pu les écrire.]

Quote: Science is the father of knowledge, but opinion breeds ignorance.
French: [translate:La science est le père du savoir, mais l'opinion engendre l'ignorance.]
Context: Contrasts verified science with biased beliefs.

Quote: Doubt is uncomfortable, certainty is ridiculous.
French: [translate:Le doute est inconfortable, la certitude est ridicule.]
Context: Values skepticism in scientific search for truth.

Quote: Truth is a fruit that can only be picked if it is ripe.
French: [translate:La vérité est un fruit qu'on ne doit cueillir que s'il est mûr.]
Context: Advises patience and maturity in scientific discovery.

Quote: Nature is always right, the errors are always those of man.
French: [translate:La nature a toujours raison; les fautes sont toujours celles de l’homme.]
Context: Nature never errs, only humans do.

Quote: All men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Equality as foundation for scientific progress.

Quote: If we do not find anything pleasant, at least we shall find something new.
French: [translate:Si nous ne trouvons rien d'agréable, au moins trouverons-nous quelque chose de nouveau.]
Context: Significance of curiosity in scientific work.

Quote: Chance is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.
French: [translate:Le hasard est un mot vide de sens; rien ne peut exister sans cause.]
Context: Belief in scientific causality over luck.

Quote: The discovery of what is true and the practice of that which is good are the two most important objects of philosophy.
French: [translate:La découverte de la vérité et la pratique de la vertu sont les deux objets les plus importants de la philosophie.]
Context: Science and ethics as joint pursuits.

Quote: Only those who seek shall find.
French: [translate:Il n’y a que ceux qui cherchent qui trouvent.]

Quote: Error flies, truth comes limping after.
French: [translate:L’erreur vole, la vérité vient en boitant après elle.]

Quote: The perfection of reason is to be able to see the flaws in its own arguments.
French: [translate:La perfection de la raison est de savoir voir les défauts de ses propres raisonnements.]
Context: Self-correction as key to scientific growth.

Quote: Ignorance is a disaster for science.
French: [translate:L’ignorance est un désastre pour la science.]

Quote: Prejudice is opinion without judgment.
French: [translate:Le préjugé est une opinion sans jugement.]

Quote: Everything to be found in nature can be found in art if the artist knows where to look.
French: [translate:Tout ce qu’on trouve dans la nature peut se retrouver dans l’art, si l’artiste sait chercher.]
Context: Observational science as the root of artistic creation.

Quote: If you would converse with me, define your terms.
French: [translate:Si vous voulez parler avec moi, définissez vos termes.]

Quote: All things must be examined, debated, and investigated without exception and without regard for anyone's feelings.
French: [translate:Toutes choses doivent être examinées, débattues, et étudiées sans exception, et sans égard pour les sentiments de personne.]

Quote: Half the ills of mankind come from forgetting the importance of language.
French: [translate:La moitié des maux de l'humanité vient de l'oubli de l'importance du langage.]

Quote: Nature has no favorites.
French: [translate:La nature n’a pas de favoris.]

Quote: Men will always be mad, and those who think they can cure them are the maddest of all.
French: [translate:Les hommes seront toujours fous, et ceux qui croient pouvoir les guérir sont les plus fous de tous.]
Context: Limits of science in curing society’s ills.

Quote: Genius is only a greater aptitude for patience.
French: [translate:Le génie n'est qu'une plus grande aptitude à la patience.]

Quote: If you want to converse with me, first define your terms.
French: [translate:Si vous voulez converser avec moi, commencez par définir vos termes.]
Context: Demand for clarity in scientific dialogue.

Quote: It is dangerous to be right when the government is wrong.
French: [translate:Il est dangereux d'avoir raison dans des affaires où des hommes en place ont tort.]
Context: Warns against the risks of honest dissent in politics.

Quote: Politics is the art of lying for the good of the people.
French: [translate:La politique est l'art de mentir pour le bien du peuple.]
Context: Satirical view on the dishonesty inherent in politics.

Quote: To hold a pen is to be at war.
French: [translate:Tenir une plume, c'est être en guerre.]
Context: Writing as a form of political struggle.

Quote: Common sense is not so common.
French: [translate:Le bon sens est fort rare.]
Context: Laments the rarity of practical judgment among leaders.

Quote: The best is the enemy of the good.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l'ennemi du bien.]
Context: Warns political movements against seeking unattainable perfection.

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]
Context: Warns that bias masquerades as political principle.

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Merit should determine rights and status.

Quote: He who thinks himself wise, O heavens! is a great fool.
French: [translate:Celui qui se croit sage, ô cieux! est un grand fou.]

Quote: To succeed in the world, it is not enough to be stupid, you must also be well-mannered.
French: [translate:Pour réussir dans le monde, il ne suffit pas d'être bête, il faut aussi être bien élevé.]

Quote: In general, the art of government consists in taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
French: [translate:En général, l'art de gouverner consiste à prendre autant d'argent que possible d'une classe de citoyens pour le donner à une autre.]

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]
Context: Religion as a tool of social order.

Quote: All men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Equality in law, not social class.

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
French: [translate:Il doit être bien ignorant puisqu'il répond à toutes les questions qu'on lui pose.]
Context: Warns against politicians who claim to know all things.

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]
Context: Crime leads to unease and instability in society.

Quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood.
French: [translate:La décision la plus importante que vous puissiez prendre est d'être de bonne humeur.]

Quote: An optimist is a madman who insists all is well when he is in hell.
French: [translate:Un optimiste est un fou qui prétend que tout va bien quand il est en enfer.]

Quote: To punish me for ignorance would be injustice; to punish me for intention would be justice.
French: [translate:Me punir pour ignorance serait une injustice; me punir pour intention serait la justice.]

Quote: He who lives only for himself is truly free; all others are slaves.
French: [translate:Celui qui ne vit que pour lui-même est vraiment libre; tous les autres sont des esclaves.]

Quote: Madness is to think of too many things in succession too fast, or of one thing too exclusively.
French: [translate:La folie est de penser trop de choses à la fois, ou de n'en penser qu'une seule.]

Quote: Liberty and freedom are the language of nations.
French: [translate:La liberté et la franchise sont le langage des nations.]

Quote: The secret of being boring is to say everything.
French: [translate:Le secret d'ennuyer est de tout dire.]

Quote: Present opportunities are not to be neglected; they rarely visit us twice.
French: [translate:Les occasions présentes ne doivent pas être négligées; elles nous visitent rarement deux fois.]

Quote: Jealousy is the tyrant of love.
French: [translate:La jalousie est le tyran de l'amour.]

Quote: Power is not revealed by striking hard or often, but by striking true.
French: [translate:Le pouvoir ne se révèle pas en frappant fort ou souvent, mais en frappant juste.]

Quote: Fanaticism is a monster that professes to be the child of religion.
French: [translate:Le fanatisme est un monstre qui prétend être l'enfant de la religion.]
Context: Fanaticism as a tool of political manipulation.

Quote: We are all apprentices in a craft where no one becomes a master.
French: [translate:Nous sommes tous apprentis dans un métier où personne ne devient maître.]

Quote: To the living we owe respect, to the dead we owe only truth.
French: [translate:Aux vivants nous devons le respect, aux morts nous devons seulement la vérité.]

Quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
French: [translate:Tout homme est coupable de tout le bien qu'il n'a pas fait.]
Context: Duty neglected by the living is guilt to the dead.

Quote: Men argue; nature acts.
French: [translate:Les hommes discutent; la nature agit.]
Context: Nature’s decisiveness compared to human indecision.

Quote: When we meet with death, let us not shudder as though something unfamiliar fell upon us.
French: [translate:Quand nous rencontrons la mort, ne tremblons pas comme si quelque chose d'inconnu nous arrivait.]

Quote: Death is the only certainty in life.
French: [translate:La mort est la seule certitude de la vie.]

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: In death, status is secondary to virtue.

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]
Context: Crime brings its own psychological torment.

Quote: No snowflake in an avalanche ever feels responsible.
French: [translate:Aucun flocon de neige dans une avalanche ne se sent responsable.]

Quote: Happiness in life does not prevent death; but happiness in memory can survive it.
French: [translate:Le bonheur dans la vie n'empêche pas la mort; mais le bonheur dans la mémoire peut survivre.]

Quote: The best is the enemy of a good death.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l’ennemi d’une bonne mort.]
Context: Warns against seeking perfection even in dying.

Quote: All the world’s a stage, and death closes the scene.
French: [translate:Le monde entier est un théâtre, et la mort ferme la scène.]
Context: Death as the ending to life's drama.

Quote: Liberty is not only a right, it is a duty—even in death.
French: [translate:La liberté n’est pas seulement un droit, c’est un devoir—même dans la mort.]
Context: Rights and responsibility continue to the end.

Quote: Death levels all distinctions.
French: [translate:La mort efface toutes les distinctions.]

Quote: Death is but a change of circumstance, not an end.
French: [translate:La mort n'est qu'un changement de circonstance, non une fin.]

Quote: The art of dying is more important than the art of living.
French: [translate:L'art de mourir est plus important que l'art de vivre.]
Context: Final moments as culmination of life’s meaning.

Quote: We all die, but not all lives are remembered.
French: [translate:Nous mourons tous, mais toutes les vies ne sont pas retenues.]

Quote: Death reveals the nature of wisdom.
French: [translate:La mort révèle la nature de la sagesse.]

Quote: When life ends, truth begins.
French: [translate:Quand la vie finit, la vérité commence.]
Context: Death brings clarity absent in life.

Quote: To grieve is a tribute to love.
French: [translate:Le chagrin est un hommage à l'amour.]

Quote: Nature surrounds death with silence.
French: [translate:La nature entoure la mort de silence.]
Context: Death’s quiet in the natural world.

Quote: Even kings must die, and so their glory fades.
French: [translate:Même les rois doivent mourir, et ainsi leur gloire disparaît.]

Quote: The last words are to be chosen with care.
French: [translate:Les derniers mots doivent être choisis avec soin.]

Quote: Only the soul survives death.
French: [translate:Seule l'âme survit à la mort.]

Quote: We pass from one dream to another when we die.
French: [translate:Nous passons d’un rêve à un autre quand nous mourons.]
Context: Death as a portal to new existence.

Quote: Death is the silence in which all truths are heard.
French: [translate:La mort est le silence dans lequel toutes les vérités sont entendues.]

Quote: Writing is the painting of the voice.
French: [translate:L'écriture est la peinture de la voix.]
Context: Compares the expressive power of written words to visual painting.

Quote: All styles are good except the tiresome kind.
French: [translate:Tous les genres sont bons, sauf le genre ennuyeux.]
Context: Encourages variety and liveliness in artistic forms.

Quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
French: [translate:L'amour est un canevas fourni par la nature et brodé par l'imagination.]

Quote: The most useful books are those whose readers believe they could have written them.
French: [translate:Les livres les plus utiles sont ceux dont les lecteurs pensent qu'ils auraient pu les écrire.]

Quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
French: [translate:La musique est le raccourci de l'émotion.]
Context: Highlights music's ability to convey deep emotion.

Quote: A witty saying proves nothing.
French: [translate:Une bonne plaisanterie ne prouve rien.]
Bio: Used wit in his own works.

Quote: Art is the adornment of life.
French: [translate:L'art est l'ornement de la vie.]
Context: The role of art in enriching everyday life.

Quote: Genius is only a greater aptitude for patience.
French: [translate:Le génie n'est qu'une plus grande aptitude à la patience.]

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of geometry.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de la géométrie.]
Context: Skills and art must be learned.

Quote: To succeed in art, one must work hard, love much, and wait patiently.
French: [translate:Pour réussir dans l'art, il faut travailler dur, aimer beaucoup, et attendre patiemment.]

Quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery in the arts.
French: [translate:Les erreurs sont les portes de la découverte dans les arts.]

Quote: Art and science are sisters who have never quarreled.
French: [translate:L'art et la science sont des sœurs qui ne se sont jamais querellées.]
Context: Unity of artistic and scientific creativity.

Quote: To admire art is to discover oneself.
French: [translate:Admirer l'art, c'est se découvrir soi-même.]

Quote: Art must always be a reflection of truth.
French: [translate:L'art doit toujours être le reflet de la vérité.]
Context: Art's ethical duty to be honest.

Quote: True art is above fashion.
French: [translate:Le véritable art est au-dessus de la mode.]
Context: Distinguishes lasting art from passing trends.

Quote: Style is the dress of thought.
French: [translate:Le style est l'habit de la pensée.]

Quote: Artists are the legislators of time.
French: [translate:Les artistes sont les législateurs du temps.]

Quote: To create is to change.
French: [translate:Créer, c'est changer.]

Quote: The first requirement of art is sincerity.
French: [translate:La première exigence de l'art est la sincérité.]

Quote: Every great artist has been misunderstood.
French: [translate:Chaque grand artiste a été incompris.]

Quote: What is art but nature improved by imagination?
French: [translate:Qu'est-ce que l'art, sinon la nature améliorée par l'imagination?]

Quote: Art is the language of humanity.
French: [translate:L'art est le langage de l'humanité.]

Quote: The only way to judge art is to feel it.
French: [translate:La seule façon de juger l'art est de le ressentir.]

Quote: Artists are those who see what others only glimpse.
French: [translate:Les artistes sont ceux qui voient ce que les autres n’aperçoivent que furtivement.]

Quote: To be an artist is to refuse to be ordinary.
French: [translate:Être artiste, c'est refuser d'être ordinaire.]
Context: Art as a rebellion against mediocrity.

Quote: It is better to risk saving a guilty person than to condemn an innocent one.
French: [translate:Il vaut mieux hasarder de sauver un coupable que de condamner un innocent.]
Context: Argues for mercy in legal judgment.

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]
Context: Denounces why prejudice leads to injustice.

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Justice must be fair and virtue-based.

Quote: Virtue is not hereditary.
French: [translate:La vertu n'est pas héréditaire.]
Context: Real justice is not inherited, but earned by character.

Quote: Justice consists in doing no injury to men; decency in giving them no offense.
French: [translate:La justice consiste à ne faire aucun tort aux hommes; la décence à ne leur causer aucun désagrément.]
Context: Harms avoided should be both legal and social.

Quote: The guilty can be forgiven. The innocent must be protected.
French: [translate:Le coupable peut être pardonné. L'innocent doit être protégé.]
Context: Central Edict of Voltaire's just world.

Quote: To punish me for ignorance would be injustice; to punish me for intention would be justice.
French: [translate:Me punir pour ignorance serait une injustice; me punir pour intention serait la justice.]

Quote: Fanaticism is a monster that professes to be the child of religion.
French: [translate:Le fanatisme est un monstre qui prétend être l'enfant de la religion.]

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]

Quote: Every man is guilty of all the good he did not do.
French: [translate:Tout homme est coupable de tout le bien qu'il n'a pas fait.]
Context: Not doing good may be an injustice itself.

Quote: Justice is the first virtue of social institutions.
French: [translate:La justice est la première vertu des institutions sociales.]
Context: Fairness must be the root of all government.

Quote: It is not justice to equalize, but to give to each according to his merit.
French: [translate:Il n'est pas juste d'égaliser, mais de donner à chacun selon son mérite.]

Quote: Liberty and justice are inseparable.
French: [translate:La liberté et la justice sont inséparables.]

Quote: Justice delayed is justice denied.
French: [translate:La justice différée est une justice refusée.]

Quote: To forgive is not always justice, but justice is never revenge.
French: [translate:Pardonner n'est pas toujours la justice, mais la justice n'est jamais la vengeance.]

Quote: Law without morality is useless.
French: [translate:La loi sans la morale est inutile.]

Quote: No one is above justice, not even the king.
French: [translate:Nul n'est au-dessus de la justice, pas même le roi.]
Context: Law applies to all, powerful or not.

Quote: Justice is a contract between man and society.
French: [translate:La justice est un contrat entre l'homme et la société.]

Quote: Judges must be wiser than the laws they interpret.
French: [translate:Les juges doivent être plus sages que les lois qu'ils interprètent.]

Quote: Severe laws are never just.
French: [translate:Les lois sévères ne sont jamais justes.]

Quote: True justice can only exist where there is compassion.
French: [translate:La vraie justice ne peut exister que là où il y a compassion.]

Quote: It is easier to judge the mind of a man by his questions rather than by his answers.
French: [translate:Il est plus facile de juger l'esprit d'un homme par ses questions que par ses réponses.]
Context: Inquiry as a means to fairness.

Quote: The execution of justice is the firmest pillar of good governance.
French: [translate:L'exécution de la justice est le pilier le plus solide d'une bonne gouvernance.]
Context: Justice is central to government stability.

Quote: Let justice be done, though the world perish.
French: [translate:Que la justice soit faite, dût le monde périr.]
Context: Valued justice over personal or political gain.

Quote: Even mercy may be a form of justice, when measured and wise.
French: [translate:Même la miséricorde peut être une forme de justice, si elle est mesurée et sage.]

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
French: [translate:Plus je lis, plus j'acquiers, plus je suis certain que je ne sais rien.]
Context: Learning reveals the vastness of the unknown.

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of geometry.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de la géométrie.]

Quote: We must cultivate our garden.
French: [translate:Il faut cultiver notre jardin.]

Quote: Virtue is not hereditary.
French: [translate:La vertu n'est pas héréditaire.]
Context: Virtue is acquired through education, not blood.

Quote: The most useful books are those whose readers believe they could have written them.
French: [translate:Les livres les plus utiles sont ceux dont les lecteurs pensent qu'ils auraient pu les écrire.]

Quote: Only those who seek shall find.
French: [translate:Il n’y a que ceux qui cherchent qui trouvent.]

Quote: Ignorance is a disaster for science.
French: [translate:L’ignorance est un désastre pour la science.]
Context: Prizes education as essential to science.

Quote: He must be very ignorant for he answers every question he is asked.
French: [translate:Il doit être bien ignorant puisqu'il répond à toutes les questions qu'on lui pose.]

Quote: Prejudice is opinion without judgment.
French: [translate:Le préjugé est une opinion sans jugement.]

Quote: All things must be examined, debated, and investigated without exception and without regard for anyone's feelings.
French: [translate:Toutes choses doivent être examinées, débattues, et étudiées sans exception, et sans égard pour les sentiments de personne.]

Quote: Error flies, truth comes limping after.
French: [translate:L’erreur vole, la vérité vient en boitant après elle.]
Context: Learning from mistakes is part of education.

Quote: Half the ills of mankind come from forgetting the importance of language.
French: [translate:La moitié des maux de l'humanité vient de l'oubli de l'importance du langage.]

Quote: The perfection of reason is to be able to see the flaws in its own arguments.
French: [translate:La perfection de la raison est de savoir voir les défauts de ses propres raisonnements.]

Quote: If you would converse with me, define your terms.
French: [translate:Si vous voulez parler avec moi, définissez vos termes.]

Quote: Men argue; nature acts.
French: [translate:Les hommes discutent; la nature agit.]
Context: Learning through observation of natural order.

Quote: History is nothing but a pack of tricks we play upon the dead.
French: [translate:L'histoire n'est qu'un paquet de tromperies que nous jouons aux morts.]
Context: Critical, reflective history as educational tool.

Quote: To succeed in art, one must work hard, love much, and wait patiently.
French: [translate:Pour réussir dans l'art, il faut travailler dur, aimer beaucoup, et attendre patiemment.]

Quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery in the arts.
French: [translate:Les erreurs sont les portes de la découverte dans les arts.]

Quote: Education is the foundation of all happiness.
French: [translate:L'éducation est le fondement de tout bonheur.]

Quote: We must define words, or they will define us.
French: [translate:Il faut définir les mots, ou ils nous définiront.]
Context: Importance of clarity in teaching and debate.

Quote: Virtue is acquired through education, not inheritance.
French: [translate:La vertu s'acquiert par l'éducation, non par l'hérédité.]

Quote: The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.
French: [translate:L'art d'enseigner est l'art d'aider à découvrir.]
Context: Role of the teacher in igniting learning.

Quote: He who learns knows that he knows nothing.
French: [translate:Celui qui apprend sait qu'il ne sait rien.]
Context: Education brings awareness of one's own ignorance.

Quote: Learning is the true wealth.
French: [translate:L'apprentissage est la vraie richesse.]

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]
Context: The role of work in growth and learning.

Quote: History is nothing but a pack of tricks we play upon the dead.
French: [translate:L'histoire n'est qu'un paquet de tromperies que nous jouons aux morts.]
Context: Warns against believing history is objective truth.

Quote: To the living we owe respect, to the dead we owe only truth.
French: [translate:Aux vivants nous devons le respect, aux morts nous devons seulement la vérité.]
Context: Calls for honesty in historical memory.

Quote: It is dangerous to be right when the government is wrong.
French: [translate:Il est dangereux d'avoir raison dans des affaires où des hommes en place ont tort.]
Context: History judges those who challenge power.

Quote: Prejudices are what fools use for reason.
French: [translate:Les préjugés sont ce que les sots utilisent pour raisonner.]

Quote: Men argue; nature acts.
French: [translate:Les hommes discutent; la nature agit.]

Quote: Fanaticism is a monster that professes to be the child of religion.
French: [translate:Le fanatisme est un monstre qui prétend être l'enfant de la religion.]

Quote: All men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Bio: Praised merit in the historical record.

Quote: Fear follows crime and is its punishment.
French: [translate:La peur suit le crime et en est la punition.]
Context: Consequences of injustice persist across time.

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
French: [translate:Plus je lis, plus j'acquiers, plus je suis certain que je ne sais rien.]

Quote: History is written by the victors, not the victims.
French: [translate:L'histoire est écrite par les vainqueurs, non par les victimes.]

Quote: Chronology is the backbone of history.
French: [translate:La chronologie est la colonne vertébrale de l'histoire.]
Context: Structure is crucial to historical understanding.

Quote: A historian is a gossip who makes a living out of telling other people’s secrets.
French: [translate:Un historien est un bavard qui gagne sa vie à raconter les secrets des autres.]

Quote: To judge the past is to judge ourselves.
French: [translate:Juger le passé, c'est nous juger nous-mêmes.]
Context: History as mirror to the present.

Quote: Every epoch dreams the next.
French: [translate:Chaque époque rêve la suivante.]

Quote: History is an endless repetition of the same errors.
French: [translate:L'histoire est une répétition sans fin des mêmes erreurs.]
Context: History repeats due to human folly.

Quote: Skepticism is the first step towards truth in history.
French: [translate:Le scepticisme est le premier pas vers la vérité en histoire.]

Quote: Time, the devourer of all things, also devours history.
French: [translate:Le temps, dévoreur de toutes choses, dévore aussi l'histoire.]

Quote: Every nation has the government it deserves.
French: [translate:Chaque nation a le gouvernement qu'elle mérite.]

Quote: There is no history, only fable.
French: [translate:Il n'y a pas d'histoire, seulement des fables.]

Quote: History teaches everything, even the future.
French: [translate:L'histoire enseigne tout, même l'avenir.]

Quote: The dead govern the living.
French: [translate:Les morts gouvernent les vivants.]

Quote: Wars are the graves of great men.
French: [translate:Les guerres sont les tombes des grands hommes.]

Quote: Custom is the great guide of human life, and history is its archive.
French: [translate:L'habitude est le grand guide de la vie humaine, et l'histoire en est l'archive.]

Quote: History is often written with a pen dipped in lies.
French: [translate:L'histoire est souvent écrite avec une plume trempée dans le mensonge.]

Quote: All history fades into fable with time.
French: [translate:Toute histoire devient fabuleuse avec le temps.]
Context: Truth and legend blend across ages.

Quote: Men argue; nature acts.
French: [translate:Les hommes discutent; la nature agit.]
Context: Contrasts human indecision with nature’s decisiveness.

Quote: Nature is always right, the errors are always those of man.
French: [translate:La nature a toujours raison; les fautes sont toujours celles de l’homme.]

Quote: Music is the shorthand of emotion.
French: [translate:La musique est le raccourci de l'émotion.]
Context: Shows art’s roots in nature and feeling.

Quote: When we meet with death, let us not shudder as though something unfamiliar fell upon us.
French: [translate:Quand nous rencontrons la mort, ne tremblons pas comme si quelque chose d'inconnu nous arrivait.]

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]
Context: Work as part of the natural human condition.

Quote: The best is the enemy of the good—even in nature.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l’ennemi du bien—même dans la nature.]
Context: Stresses accepting what is good over seeking unattainable perfection.

Quote: Nature has no favorites.
French: [translate:La nature n’a pas de favoris.]

Quote: To study nature is to learn wisdom; to ignore it is to court disaster.
French: [translate:Étudier la nature c'est apprendre la sagesse; l'ignorer c'est inviter le désastre.]
Context: Advocates the study of natural world for insight.

Quote: Nature does nothing in vain.
French: [translate:La nature ne fait rien en vain.]
Context: Recognizes the wisdom in nature's order.

Quote: Nature surrounds death with silence.
French: [translate:La nature entoure la mort de silence.]

Quote: All that is natural is not always good.
French: [translate:Tout ce qui est naturel n'est pas toujours bon.]

Quote: “Chance” is a word void of sense; nothing can exist without a cause.
French: [translate:“Hasard” est un mot vide de sens; rien ne peut exister sans cause.]

Quote: Everything in nature has a purpose, but it is not ours to assign.
French: [translate:Tout dans la nature a un but, mais ce n'est pas à nous de le définir.]

Quote: The laws of nature are immutable.
French: [translate:Les lois de la nature sont immuables.]

Quote: Nature is the source of all art.
French: [translate:La nature est la source de tout art.]

Quote: To know nature is to know ourselves.
French: [translate:Connaître la nature, c'est se connaître soi-même.]
Context: Learning from nature as a mirror.

Quote: Even kings must die, and so their glory fades; nature alone endures.
French: [translate:Même les rois doivent mourir et leur gloire disparaît; seule la nature demeure.]

Quote: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
French: [translate:La nature ne se presse pas, pourtant tout s’accomplit.]

Quote: There is nothing new in nature, only new eyes to see it.
French: [translate:Il n’y a rien de nouveau dans la nature, seulement de nouveaux yeux pour la voir.]
Context: Everything exists already in nature—discovery is human.

Quote: Nature never hurries but achieves everything.
French: [translate:La nature ne se hâte jamais mais tout s’accomplit.]

Quote: The silence of nature is full of answers.
French: [translate:Le silence de la nature est plein de réponses.]
Context: Stillness as a source of understanding.

Quote: Nature teaches by examples, never by precepts.
French: [translate:La nature enseigne par des exemples, jamais par des préceptes.]

Quote: Nature avenges every violation of her laws.
French: [translate:La nature se venge de toute violation de ses lois.]

Quote: Humans are a small part of nature’s design.
French: [translate:L’homme n’est qu’une petite partie du dessein de la nature.]

Quote: Nature’s voice is one of peace, not of war.
French: [translate:La voix de la nature est celle de la paix, non de la guerre.]
Context: Warns against using nature to justify conflict.

Quote: Nature always has a solution for every problem; it is humans who cannot see it.
French: [translate:La nature a toujours une solution à chaque problème; ce sont les humains qui ne la voient pas.]

Quote: The most important decision you make is to be in a good mood.
French: [translate:La décision la plus importante que vous puissiez prendre est d'être de bonne humeur.]
Context: Promotes happiness as a conscious choice.

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]
Context: Productivity as a route to happiness.

Quote: All men are born equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that distinguishes them.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes naissent égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui les distingue.]
Context: Equality and virtue as sources of joy.

Quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
French: [translate:L'amour est un canevas fourni par la nature et brodé par l'imagination.]
Context: Imagination makes happiness possible in love.

Quote: True happiness is to be found only in small things at the heart of great solitude.
French: [translate:Le vrai bonheur ne se trouve que dans les petites choses au cœur d'une grande solitude.]

Quote: To be happy in this world, first you must be good.
French: [translate:Pour être heureux dans ce monde, il faut d’abord être bon.]

Quote: The happiness of your life depends on the quality of your thoughts.
French: [translate:Le bonheur de votre vie dépend de la qualité de vos pensées.]

Quote: Happiness in love is a rare thing: most people find pain or disappointment.
French: [translate:Le bonheur en amour est une chose rare : la plupart des gens y trouvent douleur ou déception.]

Quote: Happiness is a by-product of achievement.
French: [translate:Le bonheur est le produit dérivé de l'accomplissement.]

Quote: The key to happiness is not in seeking more, but in learning to enjoy less.
French: [translate:Le secret du bonheur n'est pas de chercher davantage, mais d'apprendre à jouir de moins.]

Quote: One can be happier by giving than by receiving.
French: [translate:On peut être plus heureux en donnant qu'en recevant.]

Quote: True happiness never comes from violence.
French: [translate:Le vrai bonheur ne vient jamais de la violence.]

Quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
French: [translate:Tout le bonheur dépend du courage et du travail.]
Context: Praised bravery and industry in finding joy.

Quote: Happiness is not to have what you want, but to want what you have.
French: [translate:Le bonheur n'est pas d'avoir ce que vous voulez, mais de vouloir ce que vous avez.]

Quote: The ability to forget is a major key to happiness.
French: [translate:La capacité d'oublier est une clé majeure du bonheur.]

Quote: The happiest of all lives is a busy solitude.
French: [translate:La plus heureuse vie de toutes est une solitude occupée.]

Quote: Happiness is the only thing worth pursuing.
French: [translate:Le bonheur est la seule chose qui mérite d'être poursuivie.]

Quote: Every age has its own happiness.
French: [translate:Chaque âge a son propre bonheur.]
Context: Each period of life brings distinct joys.

Quote: The art of happiness lies in the power of extracting happiness from common things.
French: [translate:L'art du bonheur réside dans la capacité à extraire le bonheur des choses communes.]

Quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
French: [translate:L'homme est libre au moment où il veut l'être.]

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him—to keep men happy.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer—pour rendre les hommes heureux.]
Context: God as source of comfort and joy.

Quote: Happiness is found in the journey, not the destination.
French: [translate:Le bonheur se trouve dans le voyage, non dans la destination.]

Quote: Work is a refuge from unhappiness.
French: [translate:Le travail est un refuge contre le malheur.]
Context: Productive life as protection from sadness.

Quote: Let us read and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.
French: [translate:Il faut lire et il faut danser; ces deux amusements ne feront jamais de mal au monde.]
Context: Harmless pleasures as sources of joy.

Quote: Happiness is to love and to be loved.
French: [translate:Le bonheur c'est d'aimer et d'être aimé.]

Quote: Don't think money does everything or you are going to end up doing everything for money.
French: [translate:Ne pensez pas que l'argent fait tout, ou vous finirez par tout faire pour de l'argent.]
Context: Warns against becoming a slave to wealth.

Quote: In general, the art of government consists in taking as much money as possible from one class of citizens to give to another.
French: [translate:En général, l'art de gouverner consiste à prendre autant d'argent que possible d'une classe de citoyens pour le donner à une autre.]

Quote: The most useful books are those whose readers believe they could have written them.
French: [translate:Les livres les plus utiles sont ceux dont les lecteurs pensent qu'ils auraient pu les écrire.]
Context: Values practical knowledge over costly theories.

Quote: Virtue is not hereditary.
French: [translate:La vertu n'est pas héréditaire.]
Context: Wealth or status means nothing without virtue.

Quote: Paper money eventually returns to its intrinsic value—zero.
French: [translate:La monnaie-papier finit toujours par revenir à sa valeur intrinsèque qui est nulle.]

Quote: Riches cannot buy happiness nor friendship.
French: [translate:La richesse n’achète ni le bonheur ni l’amitié.]

Quote: The law must not be sold for gold.
French: [translate:La loi ne doit pas être vendue pour de l’or.]

Quote: Poverty may be a misfortune, but avarice is a vice.
French: [translate:La pauvreté peut être un malheur, mais l’avarice est un vice.]

Quote: An honest man can make money, but only a wise man keeps it.
French: [translate:Un homme honnête peut gagner de l'argent, mais seul un homme sage sait le garder.]

Quote: Great wealth is a great slavery.
French: [translate:La grande richesse est une grande servitude.]
Context: Too much wealth leads to dependence.

Quote: The love of money is the root of all cowardice.
French: [translate:L’amour de l’argent est la racine de toutes les lâchetés.]

Quote: The man who has enough, has enough.
French: [translate:Celui qui a assez, a assez.]

Quote: The banker is a man who lends you his umbrella when the sun is shining and wants it back as soon as it rains.
French: [translate:Le banquier est un homme qui vous prête son parapluie quand il fait beau et le réclame dès qu'il pleut.]
Context: Satirical take on the financial sector.

Quote: A penny saved is still a penny.
French: [translate:Un sou économisé reste un sou.]

Quote: Money lost is little, honor lost is much.
French: [translate:L'argent perdu est peu, l'honneur perdu est beaucoup.]

Quote: Avarice blinds men to the world’s true riches.
French: [translate:L’avarice aveugle les hommes sur les vraies richesses du monde.]

Quote: It is better to be respected than to be rich.
French: [translate:Il vaut mieux être respecté que riche.]

Quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to him his own.
French: [translate:Le plus grand bien que vous puissiez faire à autrui n'est pas de partager votre richesse, mais de lui révéler la sienne.]
Context: True wealth is recognizing one’s value.

Quote: Rich and poor alike die alike.
French: [translate:Riches et pauvres meurent de la même manière.]
Context: Money does not change ultimate outcomes.

Quote: The worth of a man is not in what he has, but in what he is.
French: [translate:La valeur d’un homme n’est pas dans ce qu’il possède, mais dans ce qu’il est.]

Quote: No rich man is ever satisfied.
French: [translate:Aucun homme riche n'est jamais satisfait.]

Quote: Gold makes more fools than wisdom makes wise men.
French: [translate:L’or fait plus de fous que la sagesse ne fait de sages.]

Quote: Charity is a debt of the rich to the poor.
French: [translate:La charité est une dette des riches envers les pauvres.]
Context: Calls for giving from those with means.

Quote: Spend your money on the things money can buy. Spend your time on the things money can’t buy.
French: [translate:Dépensez votre argent pour ce que l'argent peut acheter. Passez votre temps sur ce que l'argent ne peut pas acheter.]

Quote: A man is rich in proportion to the things he can afford to let alone.
French: [translate:Un homme est riche dans la mesure où il peut se passer de choses.]

Quote: Work spares us from three evils: boredom, vice, and need.
French: [translate:Le travail éloigne de nous trois grands maux: l'ennui, le vice et le besoin.]
Context: Voltaire’s famous prescription for a meaningful life.

Quote: The happiest of all lives is a busy solitude.
French: [translate:La plus heureuse vie de toutes est une solitude occupée.]

Quote: The best is the enemy of the good—even in work.
French: [translate:Le mieux est l’ennemi du bien—même dans le travail.]

Quote: Man is free at the moment he wishes to be.
French: [translate:L'homme est libre au moment où il veut l'être.]
Context: Work provides a path to personal liberty.

Quote: To succeed in the world, it is not enough to be stupid, you must also be well-mannered.
French: [translate:Pour réussir dans le monde, il ne suffit pas d'être bête, il faut aussi être bien élevé.]

Quote: The art of teaching is the art of assisting discovery.
French: [translate:L'art d'enseigner est l'art d'aider à découvrir.]
Context: Teachers help students find new knowledge.

Quote: The worth of a man is not in what he has, but in what he is.
French: [translate:La valeur d’un homme n’est pas dans ce qu’il possède, mais dans ce qu’il est.]

Quote: A man is rich in proportion to the things he can afford to let alone.
French: [translate:Un homme est riche dans la mesure où il peut se passer de choses.]
Context: Not getting distracted by unnecessary work.

Quote: All happiness depends on courage and work.
French: [translate:Tout le bonheur dépend du courage et du travail.]
Context: Work and bravery are the backbone of joy.

Quote: Spend your money on the things money can buy. Spend your time on the things money can’t buy.
French: [translate:Dépensez votre argent pour ce que l'argent peut acheter. Passez votre temps sur ce que l'argent ne peut pas acheter.]

Quote: Mistakes are the portals of discovery in the arts.
French: [translate:Les erreurs sont les portes de la découverte dans les arts.]
Context: Failure brings learning; work uncovers new truths.

Quote: Poverty may be a misfortune, but avarice is a vice.
French: [translate:La pauvreté peut être un malheur, mais l’avarice est un vice.]
Context: Work can relieve poverty, but not greed.

Quote: A penny saved is still a penny.
French: [translate:Un sou économisé reste un sou.]

Quote: The love of work is the key to happiness.
French: [translate:L’amour du travail est la clé du bonheur.]
Context: Contentment comes from loving one’s effort.

Quote: An honest man can make money, but only a wise man keeps it.
French: [translate:Un homme honnête peut gagner de l'argent, mais seul un homme sage sait le garder.]
Context: Honest work praised over clever money-making.

Quote: To admire work is to respect effort.
French: [translate:Admirer le travail, c'est respecter l'effort.]
Context: Respect is earned through hard work.

Quote: Charity is a debt of the rich to the poor, and of the able to the needy.
French: [translate:La charité est une dette des riches envers les pauvres, et des capables envers les nécessiteux.]

Quote: Let us read and let us dance; these two amusements will never do any harm to the world.
French: [translate:Il faut lire et il faut danser; ces deux amusements ne feront jamais de mal au monde.]
Context: Work should be paired with relaxation.

Quote: Jealousy is the tyrant of work.
French: [translate:La jalousie est le tyran du travail.]

Quote: Talent is nothing without hard work.
French: [translate:Le talent n'est rien sans travail.]

Quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just share your riches, but reveal to him his own.
French: [translate:Le plus grand bien que vous puissiez faire à autrui n'est pas de partager votre richesse, mais de lui révéler la sienne.]
Context: Work can encourage others to find talent.

Quote: Great wealth is a great slavery.
French: [translate:La grande richesse est une grande servitude.]
Context: Wealth may enslave those who do not love work.

Quote: Avarice blinds men to the world’s true riches.
French: [translate:L’avarice aveugle les hommes sur les vraies richesses du monde.]
Context: Greed blocks appreciation for good work.

Quote: No rich man is ever satisfied with his work.
French: [translate:Aucun homme riche n'est jamais satisfait de son travail.]

Quote: The happiness of your life depends on the quality of your work.
French: [translate:Le bonheur de votre vie dépend de la qualité de votre travail.]
Context: Quality work leads to a happy life.

Quote: Those who can make you believe absurdities can make you commit atrocities.
French: [translate:Ceux qui peuvent vous faire croire des absurdités peuvent vous faire commettre des atrocités.]
Context: Warns that false beliefs lead to harmful acts.

Quote: Doubt is not a pleasant condition, but certainty is absurd.
French: [translate:Le doute est désagréable, mais la certitude est ridicule.]

Quote: The interest I have in believing a thing is not a proof that such a thing exists.
French: [translate:L'intérêt que j'ai à croire une chose n'est pas une preuve de l'existence de cette chose.]

Quote: Men are equal; it is not birth, but virtue, that makes the difference.
French: [translate:Les hommes sont égaux; ce n'est pas la naissance, mais la vertu qui fait la différence.]
Context: Virtue defines true value in truth.

Quote: If God did not exist, it would be necessary to invent him.
French: [translate:Si Dieu n'existait pas, il faudrait l'inventer.]

Quote: Cherish those who seek the truth but beware of those who find it.
French: [translate:Aimez ceux qui cherchent la vérité, fuyez ceux qui la trouvent.]

Quote: There are truths which are not for all men, nor for all times.
French: [translate:Il y a des vérités qui ne sont pas pour tous les hommes, ni pour tous les temps.]
Context: Truth can be subjective and contextual.

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
French: [translate:Plus je lis, plus j'acquiers, plus je suis certain que je ne sais rien.]

Quote: Truth is a fruit that can only be picked if it is ripe.
French: [translate:La vérité est un fruit qu'on ne doit cueillir que s'il est mûr.]

Quote: To the living we owe respect, to the dead we owe only truth.
French: [translate:Aux vivants nous devons le respect, aux morts nous devons seulement la vérité.]

Quote: When life ends, truth begins.
French: [translate:Quand la vie finit, la vérité commence.]

Quote: History is nothing but a pack of tricks we play upon the dead.
French: [translate:L'histoire n'est qu'un paquet de tromperies que nous jouons aux morts.]

Quote: To judge a man by his questions rather than by his answers is to search for truth.
French: [translate:Il est plus facile de juger un homme par ses questions que par ses réponses.]
Context: Inquiry is the way to real truth.

Quote: Truth is often eclipsed but never extinguished.
French: [translate:La vérité est souvent éclipsée mais jamais éteinte.]

Quote: Truth is not always beautiful, but the hunger for it is.
French: [translate:La vérité n'est pas toujours belle, mais la soif de vérité l'est.]
Context: Desire for truth is noble, truth itself may be harsh.

Quote: We must define words, or they will define us.
French: [translate:Il faut définir les mots, ou ils nous définiront.]

Quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
French: [translate:L'honnêteté est le premier chapitre du livre de la sagesse.]
Context: Truth is the core of learning.

Quote: Truth is not the daughter of authority, but of time.
French: [translate:La vérité n'est pas la fille de l'autorité, mais celle du temps.]

Quote: Argument ends where truth begins.
French: [translate:La discussion s'arrête là où commence la vérité.]
Context: Admits debate is only useful until truth is found.

Quote: To love truth for truth’s sake is the principal part of human perfection.
French: [translate:Aimer la vérité pour elle-même est la plus grande perfection de l’homme.]

Quote: We often regret our first impulse, but seldom our second one when it comes to telling the truth.
French: [translate:On regrette souvent sa première impulsion, mais rarement la seconde quand il s'agit de dire la vérité.]
Context: Pausing before speaking is linked to honesty.

Quote: Genius in truth consists in knowing how far to go in telling it.
French: [translate:Le génie de la vérité consiste à savoir jusqu'où il faut la dire.]
Context: Truth must sometimes be applied carefully.

Quote: What we call truth is often only our opinion.
French: [translate:Ce que nous appelons la vérité n'est souvent que notre opinion.]

Quote: We should be more afraid of false truths than of open error.
French: [translate:Nous devrions craindre davantage les fausses vérités que l'erreur ouverte.]
Context: Insidious lies are more dangerous than obvious error.

Quote: Truth is a torch that shines through the fog without dispelling it.
French: [translate:La vérité est un flambeau qui brille dans le brouillard sans le dissiper.]
Context: Truth helps but does not solve all confusion.

Quote: To pursue truth is to risk comfort for wisdom.
French: [translate:Poursuivre la vérité, c'est risquer le confort pour la sagesse.]

Quote: The more I read, the more I acquire, the more certain I am that I know nothing.
French: [translate:Plus je lis, plus j'acquiers, plus je suis certain que je ne sais rien.]

Quote: Superstition is to religion what astrology is to astronomy.
French: [translate:La superstition est à la religion ce que l'astrologie est à l'astronomie.]

Quote: All men are born with a nose and ten fingers, but no one was born with a knowledge of geometry.
French: [translate:Tous les hommes sont nés avec un nez et dix doigts, mais aucun n'est né avec la connaissance de la géométrie.]
Context: Human knowledge must be acquired, not innate.

Quote: Only those who seek shall find.
French: [translate:Il n’y a que ceux qui cherchent qui trouvent.]
Context: Active search is required for real knowledge.
